physdesc.extent: ca. 49,000 items ( 94 boxes, and 462 v. in 31 record storage cartons )

repository.corpname: Columbia University.Rare Book and Manuscript Library,

bioghist.head: History
bioghist.p: Founded in 1924 by Jacob W. & David B. Greenberg. Sold to Chilton Book Company in 1958. Greenberg published in many fields including "how to" books, westerns, inspirational topics, health, cooking, agriculture, early gay fiction, sociology, police techniques, and theater.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The surviving editorial, production, and publicity files of Greenberg: Publisher. The Greenberg: Publisher library includes 462 titles published by the firm. Also, personal papers of Jacob Walter Greenberg consisting of letters, manuscripts, photographs, clippings, printed ephemera, and memorabilia. These are biographical in nature relating to Greenberg, his family, friends, business associates, authors, politicians, and other public figures. Among the letters are one each from public figures including Robert Benchley, Bennett Cerf, Fiorello La Guardia, and Eleanor Roosevelt.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is arranged into 6 series:

list.item: Series I: Cataloged Correspondence and Documents
Series III: Uncatalogued. correspondence and documents re: Chilton takeover
Series V: Greenberg Family Personal Papers

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Series I: Cataloged Correspondence and Documents are located on-site.

The following boxes are located off-site: Boxes 1-95, Series V: Boxes 1-4, and the 462 volumes in 31 records storage cartons. You will need to request this material from the Rare Book and Manuscript Library at least twenty-four (24) hours in advance to use the collection in the Rare Book and Manuscript Library reading room.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of specific item; Date (if known); Greenberg Publisher Records; Box and Folder; Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Columbia University Library.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Single photocopies may be made for research purposes. The RBML maintains ownership of the physical material only. Copyright remains with the creator and his/her heirs. The responsibility to secure copyright permission rests with the patron.
